name: Double Holy Kama Lady of Vengeance! (Paladin 32 / WM 7 / Monk 1) - 10 attacks per round plus Divine Might etc bonus dmg!
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi everyone,

My first post on this very active forum which is just incredible given Bioware's Neverwinter Nights (NWN) was released in 2002 (17 years ago!). This is an enormous credit to the NWN Fans out there, the administrators and contributors to this forum! 
NWN was released during my Uni days and I recently picked up the Enhanced Edition, which reminded me what a great game it still is with so much content and much nostalgia regarding my youth.
I will try my best to stick with the format of other posters out there. Hope you enjoy my first contribution.

Double Holy Kama Lady of Vengeance! (Paladin 32 / WM 7 / Monk 1) - optimized for Lvl 40
This build combines tremendous offensive power with some defensive power. It features:

Offensively it does an outstanding amount of damage per round (around 300 damage with 3 different damage types without criticals, and about 450 damage with criticals, see below) from:
Very high number of attacks from:
- Double wielding Kama's + Double Wielding Feats including Improved Two Weapon Fighting plus Monk class will yield 8 attacks / round (6 main hand, 2 off hand)
- Using Flurry of Blows and Haste (from items or potions) will yield 10 attacks / round

Exploiting the very high number of attacks with additional damage per hit from Paladin abilities
- Divine Might buffed by Eagle Splendor and Aura of Glory (+7 Divine damage with 10 attacks is +70 damage / round)
- Divine Favor (+5 magic damage -> +50 damage / round)
- Bull's Strength (+1-2 damage -> 10-20 damage / round)
- Greater Magic Weapon / Holy Avenger
- Double Imaskari Kama Acid damage (1d4) (-> 10-40 damage / round) -> if there are Kama's with better + damage modifiers certainly use them here!
- Buffs from bard companions, if available (ie +3 bludgeoning damage = 30 damage / round)

Further amplifying damage from stronger criticals and more frequent criticals from:
- Weapon Master's Ki Critical (range +2), Increased Multiplier 
- Improved Critical Feat (Kama)

Defensively it benefits from:
- Paladin Class strong saving throws from charisma buffed by Eagle Splendor / Aura of Glory + Charisma items
- Tumble class skill from Monk (+8 AC at skill level 40), Dodge, Spring Attack and access to Monk gear
- Spellcraft cross class skill for +4 saving throws against spells

It's weakness are 
- late bloomer
- it is severely feat starved needing to get both Weapon Master Feats and Double Wielding Feats
- needing to spread your attributes across strength, dexterity, wisdom, intelligence and charisma
- therefore low constitution stats and low health (careful rerolling when leveling up is highly recommended)
- weaker (but still good) against enemies with damage reduction and / or immunity to critical hits
- no cool spells such as fireball
- buffing up with all your abilities can be tedious
- some randomness from Bull Strength and Eagle Splendor

Possible improvements to the build:
Writing a guide makes has made me look at how my build could be improved. Here I might are some possible ways (not tested) this could be improved:

- Ditching the Concentration skill, and putting Int at 13, Cons at 9
- Taking Monk at Lvl 1 and 37, allowing the player to skip Exotic Weapon Proficiency at level 1, and going Paladin 31 / WM 7 / Monk 2
- Focusing on Charisma rather than Strength, would increase the offhand damage, prolong Divine Might, allow more Divine Might casts, improve Lay on Hands
- Using better items

What I do know that would not improve the build is using Power Attack instead of Flurry of Blows. Here is the math I did, using the same set up as above. 

With Power Attack (please note Flurry of Blows does not stack with Power Attack) and same set up as above
Hit Points: 378
Armor Class: 34 (36 vs Evil)
Str 32 Dex 15 Con 8 Int 14 Wis 14 Char 25
Saves: Fortitude 26 / Reflex 28 / Will 25. All +4 vs spells. +2 to saves against Evil. Immune to death magic. Immune to Fear.
BAB: 30
Attack Bonus (Imaskari Kama main, Imaskari Kama offhand, buffed with Greater Magic Weapon): +49/+46/+43/+40/+37/+34/+49/+46 plus one attack from Haste 
Damage (Imaskari Kama main, Imaskari Kama offhand, buffed with Greater Magic Weapon / Divine Might / Divine Favor) - Main: 1d6 + 16 +1d4 acid +5 slashing +5 magical +7 divine. Offhand 1d6 + 10 +1d4 acid +5 slashing +5 magical +7 divine.

Estimated damage / round without criticals -> (1d6 +16 +1d4 +5 +5 +7) x7 + (1d6 +10 +1d4 +5 +5 +7) x2 = Slashing (9d6 + 132) plus Acid (9d4) plus Magical (45) plus Divine (63) = 
258 - 330 damage per round without critical hits, of four different damage types

Assuming 1 in 5 criticals with x3 modifier (add x2 for 20% of attacks: +103.2 to 132)
361.2 - 462 damage per round, if critical hits are allowed, of four different damage types

Improved power attack I do not know the math. Possibly the -10 AB from the skill could be prohibitive so I would assume it wouldn't be worth it.

I've also tested using 9 Ranger Levels (for the dual wielding feats with no armor / light armor, and to allow you to not have such a high dexterity level) instead of 7 Levels of Weapon Master, and it feels weaker when I put my left-over feats into Greater Strength, with poor synergy with the Ranger abilities. My suggestion is it isnt as strong.

Finally
Thanks for reading, and hope you enjoyed my guide!!!! 
Hope its a unique contribution to the builds listed here, as I haven't seen anything similar in the forum, but do speak up if you have written a similar build previously, I would be delighted to have the opportunity to read it.
Happy gaming!!!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: Hi everyone,

My first post on this very active forum which is just incredible given Bioware's Neverwinter Nights (NWN) was released in 2002 (17 years ago!). This is an enormous credit to the NWN Fans out there, the administrators and contributors to this forum! 
NWN was released during my Uni days and I recently picked up the Enhanced Edition, which reminded me what a great game it still is with so much content and much nostalgia regarding my youth.
I will try my best to stick with the format of other posters out there. Hope you enjoy my first contribution.

Finally
Thanks for reading, and hope you enjoyed my guide!!!! 
Hope its a unique contribution to the builds listed here, as I haven't seen anything similar in the forum, but do speak up if you have written a similar build previously, I would be delighted to have the opportunity to read it.
Happy gaming!!!
Welcome Orion!

Positive feedback:
You seem to have put a lot of work into this, at least in terms of analysis, and you want to share your findings. 

General feedback:
As posted, this build is not finished, and not legal. You have not taken any general feat on lvl 27. You have taken 25 cross classed ranks of Spellcraft by level 38. And you spend more skillpoints than you have.
You claim that this build has 4 different damage types. It only has 3; slashing, divine and magical. What you have on your weapon is irrelevant, you could just as well have a weapon with a negative, fire, lightning, acid, cold, sonic, piercing and bludngening damage bonus and claim that the build has 11 different damage types. The point is that we post our builds as they are, naked, like you do at first, for easier comparison. We may sometimes also be interested in what the capped values are, maxed out with items, and we want to know what self-buffers can achieve with their own buffs.

As for the build:
A strength build that starts with Str 14 and ends with only 23 is not very good. If you took G-strength on your unused epic feat, your AB will be 42. Your Paladin buffs will do a lot to help, when they become available.
A monk with a naked AC of 24 is not very good. If you can cap both Dex and Wis, it will be 36, and that is good. But the single tumble dump and the Monk AC bonus from Wis come very late, so you have to suffer a very low AC throughout most of the career of the character. When you rely on dex based AC, you also want Uncanny dodge, which this build does not have.
Cha 14 is a bit low for a serious charisma build, even if you can self buff charisma. E.g. 11 damage x 11 rounds that you can achieve with a base charisma of 20 is twice as good as the 8 damage x 8 rounds that is the max of this build.
You are very ambitious when you want WM, ITWF, and DM in a single build like this, and like you say, it is feat starved. As a consequence you take a lot of pre epic feats in epic levels. A build with the ambition to dual wield and have 10 attacks per round with magical and divine damage, would do much better with a higher strength or charisma from great ability feats. Many beginners make this mistake; they want too much to go into the build, and as a consequence the build becomes weaker. We have all been there.

Edit: Clarified the text above.

Is there a way to take uncanny dodge as a feat, instead of as a class ability??

A lot will depend on how heavy you're planning to go in each class, but many dexers are playable without UD, with the proper precautions and play-style. And alas, no, UD is not available as a general feat.

One thing these 3 classes have going for them is Wisdom, and if you load that stat highly it will bump your AC like Dex does (Monk Wis AC), but without being susceptible to that sneak damage. The downside is on the AB. But if you decided to go for a Strength build with high Wis...

Maybe it would be best if we continued this one in the Build Requests/ Unfinalized Builds section?

Cheers

Love the build. CoT certainly allows you to save on feats and adds extra stats/saves and allows you not to have to lvl intelligence so high. Much more forgiving than WM (but I love the crits LOL).
Is it worth getting Monk at Lvl 1 for the extra skill points? You'd want to make your next Tumble dump a bit earlier than 17 if you do that. 
Also if you wanted to lvl Heal higher than 14(17) you could put Int and Wis at 12 and level Wisdom to 14 rather than 16 (for -1AC, you are using Divine Shield to offset this)
You could also get power attack earlier for earlier access to Divine Might, if you wanted

I took monk at lvl 2 for the tumble dump and still get the weapon proficiecy before the feat at level 3. It is indeed possible to start with monk for the extra 8 skill points. I didn't start with wisdom 12, because then you have to wait too long for the level 3 and 4 paladin spells.
I took great wisdom on two CoT bonus feats. It helps AC, the will saves and gives an extra level 3 spell-slot. But most imprtantly I took  CoT to lvl 10 for the better saves and Divine Wrath. If you take great cleave pre epic, you may be able to squeeze in dev crit with the bonus feats instead.
The build is open to several tweaks. The most obvious is perhaps that you can get +2 AB and damage if you take strength to 30 instead of improving the charisma. But that hurts all the divine feats and the saves.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Welcome to the guild Orion, it is always nice to see some enthusiasm in here.
And what a nice build with 10 attacks, weapon master's criticals & full Paladin spells!

Your build, should you care to improve it, could switch some levels like this: Paladin 20/ Weapon Master 19/ Monk 1.
Do that & you just gained 3AB.
All the bonus WM's feats are similar to Paladin's & you will only lose toughness.
You might also attain 24 Str fairly easily (you miss a general feat on 33rd level).

That's all for now, keep building & Improving your skills.
